intro: Pneumonanthe ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-leafed lungwort, is a striking member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow leaves that contrast with its dark green stems, creating a visually appealing appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its flowers are usually clustered in racemes and display a range of colors from yellow to orange, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are often lobed or divided, contributing to its distinctive botanical profile.
